text:
An activist, who was part of a group protesting mining operations in Cauvrem village of South Goa, was allegedly assaulted by inmates inside a judicial lock-up in Sada sub-jail here, police said today.

According to police, Ravindra Velip, who was among five activists arrested on Wednesday, was assaulted the same night by the inmates.

“We received information that an inmate was assaulted in Sada judicial lock-up. We approached Velip, but he refused to file a formal complaint,” police inspector Kapil Naik, in charge of Mormugao police station, told reporters here.

The assault happened minutes before Mr. Velip was to be released on bail.

“Once he was out on bail, he went to the Goa Medical College and got himself treated,” a senior jail official said. — PTI
title: Activist attacked in jail
